results.title: Prison officer. Part 2
results.brief_description: Interviews with prisons officers and their wives, and also with prisoners, complete a broad picture pf Britains; penal system in operation, and its demands and effects on the individual on both sides of the bars.

results.title: Prison officer. Part 1
results.brief_description: The work of prison officers in Britain, seen in the daily routine at a particular prison (Wakefield). Scenes of their training course show how trainee officers are taught to understand the male prisoner and how they can assist his rehabilitation.

results.title: Prism of purpose
results.brief_description: Gabo Island - Artist Alexandra Lyall’s paintings of the Gabo Island lighthouse provide haunting visuals to her moving account of the role the lighthouse played in a tragic family history.This work uses digital technology cleverly to allow you to experience Alexandra’s paintings in a new way.

results.title: Prior and present experience (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Kismet Films and Robert E. Gilbert
results.brief_description: Uses a field trip to point out the need for careful consideration by the teacher of the often unnoticed differences between backgrounds of both students and teachers. Explains that teachers must co-ordinate and supplement both home and school experiences of students.
results.description: Uses a field trip to point out the need for careful consideration by the teacher of the often unnoticed differences between backgrounds of both students and teachers. Explains that teachers must co-ordinate and supplement both home and school experiences of students.

results.title: Prints
results.brief_description: Presents a number of simple printmaking processes, including found-object, vegetable and roller printing, string and cardboard printing and crayon graffito. Opens up a wide range of possibilities for individual exploration and experimentation. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Printmaking: four artists, four media
results.brief_description: Printmaking can be divided into four basic methods: serigraph, or silk-screen; woodcut; lithograph; and intaglio, which includes dry-point, mezzotint, engraving, etching and aquatint. In the workshops of four printmakers we see how each method progresses from sketch to finished print, including the special equipment and skills required by each method. Differences in production and the finished artwork are contrasted.

results.title: Printmakers
results.brief_description: Shows five outstanding American graphic artists - Warden Day, Karl Schrag, Seong Moy, Gabor Peterdi, and Mauricio Losavsky - at work in their respective studios. Describes the technical skills of each in his individual approach to the art of printmaking.

results.title: Printing presses and engineering: one of our own kind
results.creator_credit: Leslie Sansom, Vickers Films, John Edwards and Peter Baylis
results.brief_description: Documentary on printing in Yorkshire, Town of Otley, iron casting and printing press made in the 1880s and mass produced in Leeds for distribution overseas. Printing from paper to bottle caps and uptodate methods. Narrated by Anthony Quayle.
